maria.name: Maria Tribe
maria.subheading: Forest-dwelling tribe known for strong community life and traditional dances
maria.description:
About the Maria Tribe

• Lives mainly in the forest regions of Abujmarh, Bastar
• Known for strong community life and simple living
• Deeply connected to nature and forest resources

Daily Life
• Farming, hunting, fishing, and forest produce collection
• Houses made from mud, wood, and thatched roofs
• Community decisions are taken together

Culture & Traditions
• Famous for the Bison Horn Dance
• Traditional drums and folk music
• Festivals celebrated with rituals and group dances

Food Habits
• Rice as staple food
• Chapda (red ant chutney)
• Mahua flowers and forest vegetables

gond.name: Gond Tribe
gond.subheading: One of India’s largest tribes famous for art and nature worship
gond.description:
About the Gond Tribe

• One of the largest tribal communities in India
• Found across Bastar and southern Chhattisgarh
• Rich history of art, folklore, and traditions

Beliefs & Lifestyle
• Worship nature, trees, animals, rivers, and hills
• Farming and forest collection are main occupations
• Art is an important part of daily life

Art & Culture
• Famous for Gond paintings using dots and lines
• Paintings show animals, trees, and village life
• Folk songs are sung during festivals and farming

Festivals & Food
• Madai, Hareli, and Polam Pandum festivals
• Rice, mahua, forest fruits, and vegetables

korwa.name: Pahadi Korwa
korwa.subheading: Vulnerable hill tribe living traditionally with deep dependence on forests
korwa.description:
About the Pahadi Korwa Tribe

• Classified as a Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group (PVTG)
• Lives in hilly and forest areas of northern Chhattisgarh
• Very limited influence of modern lifestyle

Living Style
• Depends heavily on forests for survival
• Lives in small huts made from mud and bamboo
• Collects food from deep forest areas

Traditional Skills
• Archery and hunting skills
• Making tools from forest materials
• Strong knowledge of forest paths and nature

Food Sources
• Mahua collection
• Roots, tubers, and wild fruits
